text: Hello everyone, Here is the article I referenced about removing unused CSS selectors <https://addyosmani.com/blog/removing-unused-css/>
Does anyone know if i set a variable at the blog post level, can I access that in the listing for loop via HubL?
You could try setting the variable to a crazy string like asdfasdfasdf and then doing the developer info and cmd-f for it on the listing and see if it is there
It is a possibility, but i'm not sure
No such luck. doesn’t seem to show.
you verify that it shows on the post page?
if it works it is kinda hacky and wouldn't be able to be used until page loads... not sure your use case so this may not work at all
Yup, shows on the post. not on the listing.
I wonder if you could create a hubdb to store the variables for the post IDs and access....?
It’s like i need the set variable to “export to template context”...
Hey <!channel> just wanted to intro myself. I am Tim, big cheese at <http://inboundlabs.co|inboundlabs.co>. Super excited to collaborate here on the HubDB alpha.
hey <@U27V4MTK9> whats with the w. subdomain? I click your link and go here: <http://w.inboundlabs.co/>
yeah. we had to switch HS portals a while back. Took HS weeks to eliminate the already used www. form the old portal. Had to improvise and had no time yet to switch it back.
